pageContext.claim: “[Rep. Ilhan] Omar laughed that Americans speak of Al-Qaeda in a menacing tone and remarked that, ‘You don't say America with this intensity. You say Al-Qaeda makes you proud. Al-Qaeda makes you proud.’”
pageContext.analysis: Before she was elected to Congress, Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-Minn.) in a 2013 interview noted how one of her college professors would accentuate the Arabic names of terrorist groups such as al-Qaeda for effect. She was not proclaiming support for al-Qaeda in that interview and in fact condemned terrorism as evil. Trump twisted these remarks to claim Omar supports terrorists and that al-Qaeda made her proud.
